commit.title: [toplevel] Split toplevel and compiler binaries.
commit.message:
[toplevel] Split toplevel and compiler binaries.

Thanks to some factoring of code done in previous PRs, we can now make
`coqc` a truly standalone binary. Thus, `coqtop -compile` becomes non
supported as `coqtop` does only support now the interactive mode.

This should solve problems related to `coqc` having its own argument
parsing, and reduces the number of strange argument combinations a
lot.

For now this PR is in the RFC stage, and depends on # , but we are not
far, IMHO, from having a mergeable version.

Some things maybe to do before merge:

- implement a compatibility mode for `coqtop -compile`, and the rest
  of arguments which will emit a deprecation warning and call `coqc`,

- refactor `Coqargs` as to clearly have a set of common arguments,
  plus a set of compile-only, interactive only ones.

However I think that 2 should only be done in this PR if we skip the
deprecation phase mentioned in 1.

- implement a compatibility mode for `coqtop -compile`, and the rest
  of arguments which will emit a deprecation warning and call `coqc`,

- refactor `Coqargs` as to clearly have a set of common arguments,
  plus a set of compile-only, interactive only ones.

However I think that 2 should only be done in this PR if we skip the
deprecation phase mentioned in 1.

commit.title: [toplevel] Split toplevel and compiler binaries.
commit.message:
[toplevel] Split toplevel and compiler binaries.

Thanks to some factoring of code done in previous PRs, we can now make
`coqc` a truly standalone binary. Thus, `coqtop -compile` becomes non
supported as `coqtop` does only support now the interactive mode.

This should solve problems related to `coqc` having its own argument
parsing, and reduces the number of strange argument combinations a
lot.

For now this PR is in the RFC stage, and depends on # , but we are not
far, IMHO, from having a mergeable version.

Some things maybe to do before merge:

- implement a compatibility mode for `coqtop -compile`, and the rest
  of arguments which will emit a deprecation warning and call `coqc`,

- refactor `Coqargs` as to clearly have a set of common arguments,
  plus a set of compile-only, interactive only ones.

However I think that 2 should only be done in this PR if we skip the
deprecation phase mentioned in 1.
